title: Python3 support
body:
Fixes #2807.

I am cleaning up the concretizer, and part of that is cleaning up `package_prefs` and the use of `cmp`/`__cmp__` on `Specs`.  It turns out this is also something we need for Python 3.

So I went ahead and did all the easy stuff to get spack to work in Python 3.  I'm still working on the refactoring parts.  

Currently, Spack will run if invoked with `python3`, but it'll fail when it hits the first `sorted(..., cmp=...)` call.  I think there should be relatively few major issues getting Python3 to work after that is resolved, and we'll have easier code to port for the new concretizer.

- [x] remove version guard in `bin/spack`
- [x] update YAML version in externals
- [x] port `ordereddict_backport`
- [x] vendor [`six`](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/six) to aid with porting
- [x] Fix StringIO, print, except as, octals, izip calls, xrange, etc.
- [x] use `six.string_types` instead of `basestring`
- [x] use `six.iteritems`
- [x] Remove assumptions about `ascii` in the code base
- [x] Fix packages that have moved (`urllib`, etc.)
- [x] Fix UTF-8 issues with `proc.communicate` in `Executable`
- [x] Remove use of `cmp` in the code
- [x] Try to use `str` nearly everywhere in the spack code; avoid `unicode` objects in 2.x, but handle utf-8 gracefully in Python 3.
- [x] Refactor and simplify handling of deptypes in the concretizer
- [x] Fix #2807: ordering issues with merging providers & vdeps in concretization.
- [x] Fix minimum version checking (add `pyqver3`)
- [x] Clean up a number of spec tests to NOT depend on DB ordering
- [x] Add Python3 to Travis testing
